Author: jl777c#5810
Content: overfill would leave no sell left

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: partial fill leaves some left and so 's' -> 'S" or 'S' -> 'S;

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once it is overfilled or exactly filled, it disappears

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if there is any left, it needs to stay on the orderbook

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and I made both 's' and 'S' tx be mostly alike

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the same logic to fill an 's' can be used for 'S'

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, I figured out how to do micropayments, well actually mempool based payments that is secure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think that will be the next one to do

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and really, it isnt limited to small payments, it can work with any size

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but I think I will limit it to 32-bits of 0.0001 denomination -> 4 billion  / 10000 -> 400,000 would be the max payment

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: ðŸ˜± I want micropayments!!!!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: seems in Sept timeframe I can get it ready, barring bug barrage from existing codes

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: can you explain a bit on difference between your idea of micropayments and lightening network ?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: from your point of view ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mine is a simple approach that most people should be able to understand. no crazy complicated bidirectional channel scripts. it is also a direct p2p approach, so you need to specifically reserve funds for specific payee

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: seems a good tradeoff as I dont have 3 years to get a micropayments system working, I want to be done in 3 weeks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: The way it will work is you lock funds into a payments address. this can be added to whenever, using similar concepts to the faucetfunding/rewardsfunding
